TopicTitle: Largest Rocket in KSP History (First stage only)

Articles.Content:
![ihpIJBn.png](http://i.imgur.com/ihpIJBn.png)

I went a lil insane using the RO Seadragon mod cfg thing. And came up with a 1.4 million ton rocket. FAR hates me, but its just the first stage. I will add 2nd stage and fairing later. For now, Ill take a break. This caused several crashes today from the thrust plates. I changed the attach rules instead.

Eh, I'm sure Whackjob's built bigger! ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif)

Nevertheless, that is a magnificently huge rocket, well done! I can't wait to see the whole thing!

Yeah with procedural parts Its theoretically possible to create an infititely large first stage assuming KSP could handle a part that big, and you have a computer the size of the universe to run it. I know I've made launch clamps 80km tall, so that's or the 2 km physics range is probably the actual limit of the size.

Anyways, one thing that I have noticed is how the longer I have played KSP, the less impressive gigantic rockets are to me, and the more impressive tiny rockets are.

As in, corrupting every craft file, making it impossible to build things,and forcing your hands at a reinstall. Plus you gotta click a lot for the thing to get to the size its at. Such as this which is 100 meters long and 200 meters tall. 

Cheers!
